page.title: 11Pig farming
page.content: The{pig unit}is on Moss Colliery Road. It has been in existence for twenty-one years and has eight hectares of land,{mainly grassland. They chose to set up business here because their original site was damaged by fire and this was the best site available. The unit has{three hundred pigs, {twenty-two cows}and{a few hens.}The pigs are kept in pig sties and are not bred on the farm but are bought in. they are kept for five to seven months before being sent to{slaughter}for butchers to provide{bacon}and{pork. Two people are employed on the farm and they work a thirteen hour day and work seven days a week. About three times a year the {Ministry of Agriculture}come to check the farm to see it is up to standard, they always arrive unannounced!
